articles.title: Twitter reinstates blue ticks for some media houses, celebrities - The Economic Times

articles.author: Devina Sengupta, Manjul Paul
articles.title: IT firms may see a sharp decline in attrition rate | Mint - Mint
articles.description: In the March quarter, Infosys’s attrition rate fell to 20.9%, a decrease from 24.3% in the preceding three months, while HCL Technologies and Tata Consultancy Services’ attrition rates dropped to 19.5% and 20.1%, respectively.
articles.content: MUMBAI : Indias software services companies are expected to see a sharp drop in attrition rates in the coming quarters, from the current 20%-plus to as low as 16%, as the impact of hiring freezes and… [+2991 chars]

articles.title: ‘Crypto regulations will not be effective without global consensus’, says FM Nirmala Sitharaman | Mint - Mint
articles.description: Underlining that global consensus is necessary for regulation of crypto, before India makes any move on it, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said a global template may have to be created, and everyone will have to work together on it.

articles.title: Eight Of Top 10 Firms Lose Rs 1.17 lakh Crore In Market Valuation; Infosys Biggest Laggard - BQ Prime
articles.description: Eight of the 10 most valued firms faced a combined erosion of Rs 1,17,493.78 crore in market valuation in an overall weak trend in equities last week, with Infosys taking the biggest hit.
